bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to George L. Rives, February 18, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, Feb'y. 18th, 1889
Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Report of the Consular Agent at Elmina, Gold Coast Colony for the quarter ended Dec. 31st 1888.
Consulate General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, Feb'y 18th, 1889
Honorable G. L. Rives Assistant Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor repsctfully to transmit herewith the report of the Consular Agent at Elmina, Gold Coast Colony for the quarter ended, Dec. 31 1888, as follows: Arrivals and departures of American vessels; Detailed report of official service to American vessels and seamen; Summary of business; Return of trade during the year 1888.
I have the honor to be, sir, your obedient servant.
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General.
1. Arrivals and departures of Am. vessels 2. Detailed report of official service to Am. vessels 3. Summary of business 4. Return of trade during the year 1888.
